result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry Lee Tucker

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on November 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.

2:17 PM Defendant Terry Lee Tucker in court, in custody.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria in court for Terry Lee Tucker.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives his right to extradition. Defendant signs waiver in open court. Bond revoked. 
Review hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on October 26, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

3:29 PM Defendant Terry Lee Tucker in court.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant to contact the Public Defender's Office.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Indigency hearing on October 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

03:42 PM  Defendant Terry Lee Tucker appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria appeared by video for Terry Lee Tucker.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. $1000.00 signature bond set with conditions. Remand to Judge Morse to get attorney, does not qualify for public defender.
Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Maintain absolute sobriety.
